title: NIA Judge Did Not Join the BJP, A Congress Leader Did
subtitle: Fact Check: A viral message on Twitter, shared by several veteran journalists, claimed that NIA judge Ravindra Reddy, who acquitted Swami Aseemanand in the Mecca Masjid blasts case.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
Reddy had, on 16 April 2018, resigned from his post as an NIA judge, only hours after delivering his verdict in the Mecca Masjid blasts case. Reddy had cited “personal reasons” for his resignation, and had also applied for leave, reported The Hindu. However, three days later, he resumed work at the court, the report added.

Later that year, in October, Reddy joined the Telangana Jana Samiti, which was part of the alliance led by Congress in the state for the state Assembly elections, reported NDTV.

The NDTV report had added: “Mr Reddy had expressed keenness to join the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), describing it as a "patriotic party", and banners welcoming him into the party were put up at the state BJP headquarters here, but it did not materialise.”

This is possibly where the claim could have originated from.
